meta.description:
Label Generation Rules for Finnish

Overview

This document specifies a reference set of Label Generation Rules for Finnish using a limited repertoire as appropriate for a second level domain.

Repertoire

Most references converge on 30 Latin code points.

The list of IDN characters by the .fi ccTLD includes the core Finnish alphabet as well as extensions for the Sami languages written in Finland.

Excluded code points

Letters documented in some references but not included:

  • U+00E0 LATIN SMALL LETTER A WITH GRAVE

  • U+00E7 LATIN SMALL LETTER C WITH CEDILLA

  • U+00E8 LATIN SMALL LETTER E WITH GRAVE

  • U+00E9 LATIN SMALL LETTER E WITH ACUTE

  • U+00EA LATIN SMALL LETTER E WITH CIRCUMFLEX

  • U+00EB LATIN SMALL LETTER E WITH DIAERESIS

  • U+00ED LATIN SMALL LETTER I WITH ACUTE

  • U+00EE LATIN SMALL LETTER I WITH CIRCUMFLEX

  • U+00EF LATIN SMALL LETTER I WITH DIAERESIS

  • U+00F0 LATIN SMALL LETTER ETH

The following code points are not included in the current repertoire;they are extensions needed to write Lule Sami, Skolt Sami, and Northern Sami, minority languages in Finland.

  • U+010D LATIN SMALL LETTER C WITH CARON

  • U+0111 LATIN SMALL LETTER D WITH STROKE

  • U+014B LATIN SMALL LETTER ENG

  • U+0167 LATIN SMALL LETTER T WITH STROKE

  • U+01E5 LATIN SMALL LETTER G WITH STROKE

  • U+01E7 LATIN SMALL LETTER G WITH CARON

  • U+01E9 LATIN SMALL LETTER K WITH CARON

  • U+01EF LATIN SMALL LETTER EZH WITH CARON

  • U+0292 LATIN SMALL LETTER EZH

Note: the code point U+00E1 LATIN SMALL LETTER A WITH ACUTE (Northern Sami, Inari Sami) is already part of the core repertoire for other uses and the code point U+00F5 LATIN SMALL LETTER O WITH TILDE (Skolt Sami) is part of set of extended code points.

Extended code points

A number of letters not considered essential to writing the core vocabulary of the language are nevertheless in common use. Where they have not been added to the core repertoire, they are flagged as "extended-cp" in the table of code points. A context is provided that by default will prohibit labels with extended code points. To support extended single code points or code point sequences, delete the context "extended-cp" from their repertoire definition.

Variants

None.

Character Classes

This LGR defines no named character classes.

Rules

Common rules only:

  • Hyphen Restrictions — restrictions on the allowable placement of hyphens (no leading/ending hyphen and no hyphen in positions 3 and 4). These restrictions are described in section 4.2.3.1 of RFC5891 [120]. They are implemented here as context rule on U+002D (-) HYPHEN-MINUS.

  • Leading Combining Marks — restrictions on the allowable placement of combining marks (no leading combining mark). This rule is described in section 4.2.3.2 of RFC5891 [120].

Actions

Actions included are the default actions for LGRs as well as those needed to invalidate labels with misplaced combining marks.

Methodology and Contributors

This reference LGR for Finnish for the 2nd Level has been developed by Michel Suignard and Asmus Freytag, verified in expert reviews by Michael Everson, Nicholas Ostler, and Wil Tan, and based on multiple open public consultations.

References

General references for the language:

  • Finska språbykrån. 1992. In Icelandic Council for Standardization. 1992. Nordic cultural requirements on information technology. Reykjavík: Staðlaráð Íslands. ISBN 9979-9004-3-1

  • Wikipedia: "Finnish orthography", http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finnish_alphabet

  • Omniglot: Finnish (suomi) http://www.omniglot.com/writing/finnish.htm

In the listing of the repertoire by code point, references starting from [0] refer to the version of the Unicode Standard in which the corresponding code point was initially encoded. Other references (starting from [100]) document usage of code points. For more details, see the Table of References below.

reference.comment: Code points cited were originally encoded in Unicode Version 1.1

references.reference: The Unicode Consortium. The Unicode Standard, Version 6.3.0, (Mountain View, CA: The Unicode Consortium, 2013. ISBN 978-1-936213-08-5) http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.3.0/
Internetstiftelsen i Sverige (IIS), "IDN Reference table for Finnish language" https://github.com/dotse/IDN-ref-tables/blob/master/language-tables/finnish-lang-ref-table.txt
RFC5891, Internationalized Domain Names in Applications (IDNA): Protocol http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5891

reference.comment: This table lists only the characters outside the set a-z

references.reference: ISO/IEC 6937 Third Ed. 2001-12-17- Information technology — Coded graphic character set for text communication — Latin alphabet: Table D.1 (p 35) Use of Latin alphabetic characters.

reference.comment: Code points cited form the standard set

references.reference: Everson, Michael. The Alphabets of Europe: "Finnish" http://www.evertype.com/alphabets/finnish.pdf

reference.comment: Code points cited are from an extended set

references.reference: Everson, Michael. The Alphabets of Europe: "Finnish" http://www.evertype.com/alphabets/finnish.pdf

reference.comment: Code points cited are rare or archaic

references.reference: Everson, Michael. The Alphabets of Europe: "Finnish" http://www.evertype.com/alphabets/finnish.pdf

reference.comment: Code points cited are from the set of Main Letters

references.reference: The Unicode Consortium, Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) Version 28 (2015-09-16) - Locale Data Summary for Finnish [fi] http://www.unicode.org/cldr/charts/28/summary/fi.html

reference.comment: Code points cited are from the Auxiliary set

references.reference: The Unicode Consortium, Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) Version 28 (2015-09-16) - Locale Data Summary for Finnish [fi] http://www.unicode.org/cldr/charts/28/summary/fi.html

reference.comment: Code points cited are of category 1: Letters essential for the language

references.reference: Finska språbykrån. 1992. In Icelandic Council for Standardization. 1992. Nordic cultural requirements on information technology. Reykjavík: Staðlaráð Íslands. ISBN 9979-9004-3-1

reference.comment: Code points cited are of category 2: Letters commonly used, but not essential

references.reference: Finska språbykrån. 1992. In Icelandic Council for Standardization. 1992. Nordic cultural requirements on information technology. Reykjavík: Staðlaráð Íslands. ISBN 9979-9004-3-1

reference.comment: Code points cited are of category 3: Letters used for names, in common practice

references.reference: Finska språbykrån. 1992. In Icelandic Council for Standardization. 1992. Nordic cultural requirements on information technology. Reykjavík: Staðlaráð Íslands. ISBN 9979-9004-3-1

reference.comment: Code points cited are of category 4: Letters that are rarely used

references.reference: Finska språbykrån. 1992. In Icelandic Council for Standardization. 1992. Nordic cultural requirements on information technology. Reykjavík: Staðlaráð Íslands. ISBN 9979-9004-3-1

reference.comment: Code points cited are supported in a national edition of ISO-646.

references.reference: ISO/IEC 646:1991 — Information technology — ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange

reference.comment: According to this reference, the alphabet is listed as using the full basic set A-Z
The table only lists code points beyond A-Z
Code points cited are listed as in extended use --s s and z caron as recommended for transcribing foreign words

references.reference: Finnish Communications Regulatory Authority, (fi-domain) "Native language characters in domain names" https://domain.fi/info/en/index/hakeminen/mitavoihakea/aakkoset.html

char.comment: LATIN SMALL LETTER A WITH ACUTE
LATIN SMALL LETTER A WITH CIRCUMFLEX
LATIN SMALL LETTER A WITH TILDE
LATIN SMALL LETTER A WITH DIAERESIS
LATIN SMALL LETTER A WITH RING ABOVE
LATIN SMALL LETTER O WITH TILDE
LATIN SMALL LETTER O WITH DIAERESIS
LATIN SMALL LETTER O WITH STROKE
LATIN SMALL LETTER U WITH DIAERESIS
LATIN SMALL LETTER S WITH CARON
LATIN SMALL LETTER Z WITH CARON

rule.name: leading-combining-mark
rule.comment: RFC5891 restrictions on placement of combining marks

rule.name: hyphen-minus-disallowed
rule.comment: RFC5891 restrictions on placement of U+002D
no consecutive hyphens in third and fourth

rule.name: extended-cp
rule.comment: code points from the extended range

action.comment: by default, labels with leading combining marks are invalid
